title: How to Make Store‐Bought Frosting Better

steps.title: Flavor the frosting with syrup.
steps.content: Flavor the frosting with syrup. Empty a can of frosting into a large mixing bowl using a spatula or spoon. Add around 1 teaspoon (5 mL) of a flavored syrup. Mix the syrup into the frosting with an electric mixer or by hand. Taste the frosting, then mix in more of the flavored syrup, if desired. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add cream cheese for a richer taste.
steps.content: Add cream cheese for a richer taste. Put a can of frosting in a large mixing bowl and add 8 oz. of cream cheese. Use an electric mixer to combine the ingredients, or mix them together by hand. This addition provides a creamier, richer flavor to the frosting. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Flavor the frosting with food extract.
steps.content: Flavor the frosting with food extract. Use a spatula to empty a can of frosting into a mixing bowl. Add ½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) of a food extract, such as vanilla, chocolate, or orange, to the bowl and mix it into the frosting. Taste the frosting and, if desired, mix another ½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) of food extract into it for a stronger flavor.

steps.title: Mix in whipped topping to tone down the sweetness.
steps.content: Mix in whipped topping to tone down the sweetness. Empty an 8-oz. tub of whipped topping into a mixing bowl, then add one can of frosting. Mix the two together by hand or with an electric mixer. In addition to toning down the sweetness, the whipped topping also makes the frosting lighter and fluffier. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Flavor the frosting with fruit juice.
steps.content: Flavor the frosting with fruit juice. Transfer a can of frosting to a large mixing bowl with a spatula or spoon. Add 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of fruit juice, such as from a fresh-squeezed lemon or lime, to the bowl. Mix it well by hand or with an electric mixer. Taste the frosting, and, if desired, add another tablespoon or two of fruit juice to strengthen the flavor. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add 1 Tbsp of powdered sugar to thicken the frosting.
steps.content: Add 1 Tbsp of powdered sugar to thicken the frosting. Use a spatula to transfer the frosting from the container to a mixing bowl. Add 1 tablespoon (15 g) of powdered sugar to the bowl and mix it by hand or with an electric mixer. If you would like the frosting to be thicker, mix another ½ tablespoon (7.5 g) of powdered sugar into the frosting.

steps.title: Thin the frosting using ½ tsp of milk.
steps.content: Thin the frosting using ½ tsp of milk. Put the frosting in a mixing bowl using a spoon or spatula. Add ½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) of milk to the bowl. Mix it with an electric mixer or by hand. If the frosting is still too thick, mix another ½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) of milk into it. [5] X Research source You can substitute milk for water, if desired.

steps.title: Whip the frosting to make it light and fluffy.
steps.content: Whip the frosting to make it light and fluffy. Transfer the frosting to a large mixing bowl. Whip the frosting using a whisk or an electric mixer until it doubles in volume. Don’t continue whipping after the volume has doubled, or you risk creating lumps in the frosting. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Empty white frosting into a mixing bowl.
steps.content: Empty white frosting into a mixing bowl. Transfer plain white frosting to a mixing bowl using a spatula or spoon. You may want to reserve a small amount of white frosting in case you want to lighten the color of the frosting later. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Mix food coloring into the frosting.
steps.content: Mix food coloring into the frosting. Natural food coloring is better for you than artificial food coloring. You can use all one color, or use multiple colors. Mix a few drops of food coloring into the frosting by hand or with an electric mixer. Keep in mind that 100 drops of food coloring equals about 1 teaspoon (5 mL). [8] X Research source Make pink frosting by adding 11 drops of red and 3 drops of yellow. Make lavender frosting by adding 5 drops of blue and 5 drops of red. Make mint green frosting by adding 3 drops of blue and 3 drops of green.

steps.title: Adjust the color, if needed.
steps.content: Adjust the color, if needed. If the color is too dark, add more plain white frosting. If the color isn’t dark enough, add another drop or two of food coloring. Then, mix the frosting thoroughly. Continue adjusting the color until you get the desired result. [9] X Research source
